hook: If you are pulling up to Levi's Stadium expecting the usual Blue Lot party, you are going to be staring at a satellite truck instead of a grill.

sections.title: The Death of the Blue Lot
key_points: Blue Lot 1 is officially closed to the public.
The area has been repurposed as the 'Media Compound'.
The traditional heart of the 49ers tailgate scene is now a parking lot for broadcast rigs.
stats_facts: Occupied by 50+ satellite trucks and cable runs.
Displaced tailgaters forced into the Green Lot ecosystem.
sections.transition: With the heart of the tailgate ripped out, the pulse has moved to the Green Lot—but the squeeze is on.

sections.title: The Green Lot Squeeze
key_points: Green Lot 3 is the new primary tailgate zone.
Capacity has been slashed to accommodate emergency access.
Fire lanes are being enforced with zero discretion.
stats_facts: Strict 'One Spot, One Car' enforcement—no spilling into empty spaces.
sections.transition: Finding a spot is hard enough, but keeping your party running requires navigating a new level of law enforcement.

sections.title: The Multi-Agency Crackdown
key_points: Security is no longer just local Santa Clara PD.
SFPD and San Mateo units are patrolling the lots.
The 'regular' relationship with local cops does not apply here.
stats_facts: SFPD bike units patrolling Green Lot 3.
Zero Tolerance policy on open containers outside designated footprints.
Immediate ticketing for lane violations, no warnings.
sections.transition: The police aren't the only ones checking your setup; the entry gates have implemented a new layer of screening.

sections.title: The Glass and Drone Ban
key_points: Vehicle entry points are screening for glass bottles.
Confiscation bins are already filling up at the lot entrances.
stats_facts: Trunk checks active for glass containers.
FAA Temporary Flight Restriction (TFR) active from 10 AM.
Drones will be grounded and operators detained.
sections.transition: If you think you can outsmart the system by parking in the neighborhood and walking in, you are walking into a trap.

sections.title: The Perimeter Trap
key_points: The Golf Course is closed for VIP hospitality.
There is no 'overflow' parking this year.
stats_facts: Residential zones require Vehicle Access Pass (VAP).
Golf course designated as 'Clean Zone' buffer.
Towing enforced immediately in surrounding apartment complexes.
sections.transition: This year, the tailgate isn't a party—it's a tactical operation, so pack light, follow the rules, or watch the game from home.
